title: Peter Boss’s CV
text:
Rexburg, ID
peter.t.boss@gmail.com • 208-757-7891
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/peter-t-boss
Portfolio: pboss58.github.io/



Motivated Supply Chain Management student with hands-on experience in production operations, data analysis, and workflow optimization. Strong analytical background supported by a 4.0 GPA and advanced skills in Excel, SQL, and process improvement. Proven ability to lead teams, resolve operational issues, and enhance efficiency in fast-paced environments.






Bachelor of Science in Supply Chain Management (STEM); Minor: Data Science — Rexburg, ID
Jan 2023 – Dec 2026

Overall GPA: 4.0/4.0

Relevant Coursework: Global Sourcing, Logistics Management, Operations Analysis & Modeling








The Occasions Group (Taylor Corp.) — Rexburg, ID
Sep 2025 – Dec 2025

Led shipping staff in resolving workflow bottlenecks and maintaining operational continuity across 20+ brands, ensuring consistent order fulfillment

Implemented 5S at shipping stations and leveraged Novatus Office and PJM systems to streamline item retrieval and address ~30 order issues weekly

Trained and mentored 12 shipping personnel and 4 printing team members, reinforcing operational standards and improving performance





BYU–Idaho Finance Department — Rexburg, ID
Jan 2025 – Jul 2025

Graded 1,200+ advanced Excel projects involving PivotTables, VBA, dashboards, and 50+ technical functions, ensuring accuracy and consistency

Collaborated with faculty and fellow TAs to optimize grading workflow and reliably meet tight deadlines

Developed a comprehensive Excel shortcut reference resource to help students increase speed, accuracy, and competency





For the Strength of Youth Conferences (FSY, LLC) — Provo, UT
May 2024 – Jul 2024

Oversaw daily program operations for 4,900 participants over seven weeks; trained and supported 50+ counselors

Directed a large-scale variety show, managing a team of 6 and coordinating auditions, selecting 13 acts, and executing a one-hour performance

Standardized procedures, resolved operational bottlenecks, and coached staff to improve engagement and program effectiveness





For the Strength of Youth Conferences (FSY, LLC) — Provo, UT
May 2023 – Aug 2023

Led engaging learning activities for 150+ youth across three states, ensuring smooth program delivery

Collaborated with co-counselors to streamline planning for 15+ daily activities, improving operational reliability and participant experience

Resolved logistics and participation challenges by adapting activities and implementing on-the-spot solutions







Excel (Expert): Macros, Solver, Dashboards, VBA, PivotTables

SQL (Highly Proficient): JOINS, subqueries, window functions

Python (Intermediate): Functions, loops, data structures, external libraries

Tools: Power BI, Tableau, Microsoft Office

Other: Process improvement, workflow design, data cleaning






Portuguese: Fluent (oral and written)






Executive Officer — Supply Chain Management Society

Volunteer roles in church and community organizations

Full Tuition Academic Scholarship (5 semesters)

title: About Me
text:
I’m a Supply Chain Management student at BYU–Idaho with a strong interest in operations, process improvement, and data-driven decision making. I enjoy working at the intersection of people, processes, and data to improve efficiency and reliability.
I’ve gained hands-on experience through roles in production leadership and as a Spreadsheet Analysis Teaching Assistant, where I worked with Excel, SQL, and operational systems to support workflow improvements and decision-making in fast-paced environments.
I’m particularly interested in supply chain analyst, operations, and continuous improvement roles that allow me to apply analytical tools while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams. I value clear communication, accountability, and continuous learning.
This portfolio highlights selected projects that demonstrate my technical skills and problem-solving approach, with an emphasis on practical, real-world applications.

title: About Me
text:
About This Portfolio
The projects featured here focus on applied analytics, process improvement, and operational decision-making. Each project includes context, methodology, and key takeaways to illustrate both the technical tools used and the thinking behind the solution.
